abstract: The word position automaton was introduced by Glushkov and McNaughton in the early 1960. This automaton is homogeneous and has (∥E∥+1) states for an expression of alphabetic width ∥E∥. In this paper this type of automata is extended to regular tree expressions and it is shown that the conversion of a regular tree expression of size |E| and alphabetic width ∥E∥ into its reduced tree automaton can be done in O(|E|·∥E∥) time. The time complexity of the algorithm proposed by Dietrich Kuske and Ingmar Meinecke is also proved in order to reach an O(∥E∥·|E|) time complexity for the problem of the construction of the equation automaton from a regular tree expression.
meta: Conference: International Conference on Language and Automata Theory and Applications
